First Train Church Members.--In laboring where there are already some in the faith, the minister should 
                                                                           111
at first seek not so much to convert unbelievers, as to train the church members for acceptable co-operation. Let him labor for them individually, endeavoring to arouse them to seek for a deeper experience themselves, and to work for others. When they are prepared to sustain the minister by their prayers and labors, greater success will attend his efforts.--Gospel Workers, p. 196. (1915)
